project.teaser: Synthetic biology is a disruptive technology that enables completely new processes and products for industry, medical applications and food production, it makes the processes and products cheaper and more sustainable. SynBio will renew and challenge many major industries. The...
project.objective: Synthetic biology is a disruptive technology that enables completely new processes and products for industry, medical applications and food production, it makes the processes and products cheaper and more sustainable. SynBio will renew and challenge many major industries. The estimated overall market to be affected by SynBio exceeds $13 trillion. The global SynBio market is expected to grow from $5.3 billion in 2019 to $18.9 billion by 2024 with a CAGR of 28.8%. Leading European research organizations have a proven scientific record of excellence in the field. However, European science remains largely under-exploited commercially. One impact factor is difficulty to quickly consolidate transdisciplinary teams. Indeed, there is a need for clearer vision on the necessary current and future skills, required by the industry. SynBio is a relatively young discipline, made up of multiple sub-divisions, thus searching for a right profile (KOL, researcher, intern) is time-consuming for industrial companies, and can be even longer for startups. While the boom of accelerators and incubators and entrepreneurial training have driven start-up creation, the lack of specific thematic approaches can hinder the creation and/or maturation of SynBio start-ups. The SYNBEE project will address these challenges by: (i) SWOT analysis, matrix of best practices, mapping of academic profiles and industry in SynBio. (ii) General and SynBio-specific entrepreneurial training in close interaction with the industry. (iii) Networking, matchmaking between candidates and hosting and mentoring industrial partners, hackathons, pitch contests. (iv) Creation of a path from talented student to startup creation and investor workshops. (v) Policy making and mentoring between ecosystems. (vi) Specific focus will be brought to women in SynBio. SYNBEE will be implemented by key SynBio academia, industry, accelerators, investors from 25 EU countries, including 7 emerging and 6 moderate ecosystems.
project.title: SYNBEE: EXPANDING SYNTHETIC BIOLOGY ENTREPRENEURIAL ECOSYSTEMS
project.keywords: Synthetic biology, scale up, internationalization, mobility, employability, self-employment

article.title: Making an impact in synthetic biology
article.teaser: The SYNBEE project is taking action to boost entrepreneurship and networking in the field of synthetic biology in Europe.

Engineered plants could be green chemical factories of the future

result.title: A preliminary plan of workshops to provide training
result.description: A preliminary plan of workshops based on the consortiums vision will be set up We expect to organise a minimum of 46 workshops in the fields like IP VC communication preparation of a pitch nondilutive funding etc In addition a minimum of 46 workshops will be organised focused on gender bias womens role in synthetic biology leadership

result.title: Report on accompanied projects
result.description: Report covering projects in the pipeline: number, type, advancement step (TRL), strengths, barriers, non-dilutive funding opportunities, next steps, etc.

result.title: Policy making workshop report
result.description: At least 1 EU workshop will be organised in Brussels, involving policy makers. This event will allow to discuss SWOT and roadmap draft with the stakeholders and to create visibility and promote activities with education, employment authorities.

result.title: Page with shared resources on the project website
result.description: Multitude of resources exist already we will consolidate on our website links to existing webinars cources selection of links from external sources

result.title: Data management plan
result.description: A Data Management Plan will be prepared describing types of data we plan to acquire ways to make it findable accessible interoperable and to increase its reuse allocation of resources and data security

result.title: Questionnaires for 4 types of ecosystems
result.description: A questionnaire dedicated to stakeholders from 4 types of ecosystems will be shared in the frame of the consortium to generate a final version ready to be sent to stakeholders in four types of ecosystems Main objective of this questionnaire will be generation of the SWOT analysis

result.title: List of mentors
result.description: We will consolidate a database of mentors experts in IP business modeling VC regulatory affairs to expertise accompagny coach monitor the projects progress We are already in a discussion with EIT EFPIA iGEM EPIC communities as well as industry TTOs and local clusters in biotech field

result.title: Hackathons report
result.description: Report covering hackathons: number of participants, generated teams, promising projects

result.title: Report from the interviews
result.description: In addition to questionnaires interviews will take place to consolidate more solid SWOT detail information unclear from the questionnairs discover aspects we havent thought about A report from interviews will help to nurture the SWOT and the roadmap

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - SYNBEE (SYNBEE: EXPANDING SYNTHETIC BIOLOGY ENTREPRENEURIAL ECOSYSTEMS)
result.teaser: SYNBEE: Advancing Synthetic Biology Entrepreneurship in EuropeWhile European startups are growing, this expansion is uneven across countries and disciplines. Despite Europe’s leadership in SynBio research, commercialization lags behind the U.S. SynBio, a $4 trillion...
result.description: periodic

category.title: Report Summary

result.title: Female founder engagement report
result.description: A report covering female founders engagement: training, startup creation, fundraising, other related activities.

result.title: A public – private SynBio market players map
result.description: A map of synthetic biology academic labs and private companies will be consolidated.

result.title: Matrix of best practices
result.description: A Matrix of best practices will allow to prepare the mentoring tasks.

result.title: SWOT analysis per type of ecosystem
result.description: A SWOT analysis will among others allow to identify mentoring opportunities as well as gaps to focus on

result.title: White paper on entrepreneurship in SynBio education
result.description: A consolidated in-depth report, regrouping information, analysis and recommendations dedicated to explain and promote entrepreneurship in synthetic biology to different groups of stakeholders, including policy makers and general public.

result.title: Website
result.description: A project website will be set up from the project start information about project partners mission objectives planned activities events will be progressively consolidated An operational website will be launched by M5 It will be continuousely updated with project progress

result.title: Training materials and report on non-dilutive funding
result.description: A report covering a list of relevant calls for proposals, training materials, including submission rules, good practices in search for funds, application to a call for proposals and project management, etc.

result.title: Pitch competitions’ report
result.description: A report covening competition frame, statistics on number of proposals submitted and retained, evaluation procedure, intermediary steps, such as coaching and visibility created via events and matchmaking, competition outcomes, and when possible follow-up information/impact.

result.title: A database of mobility, recruitment, startup funding sources
result.description: A database of non-dilutive funding sources will be consolidated.

result.title: Roadmap
result.description: Based on SWOT analysis, we will be able to propose recommendations of next steps to implement per ecosystem

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
